CUFPOP02B.UoC Title: Determine resource requirements for total production
CUFPOP02B.Elements and Performance Criteria:
Elements and performance criteria
Element
Performance Criteria
1
Identify resource requirements from script or performance outline
1.1
Read and analyse script/performance outline scene by scene to establish detailed resource requirements. 
1.2
Establish appropriate depth and detail of information to inform production planning and decision making. 
2
Prepare and present estimates
2.1
Make informed estimates of production resource requirements taking into account all relevant considerations and using appropriate research methods. 
2.2
Accurately calculate and prepare estimates of production times. 
2.3
Liaise with relevant colleagues to discuss requirements and confirm production requirements. 
2.4
Identify potential problems with conflicting production requirements, and take appropriate action to resolve. 
2.5
Clarify requirements, roles and responsibilities between different production areas. 
2.6
Present estimates to relevant colleagues for discussion, negotiating changes and compromises as necessary. 
3
Prepare a schedule of resources
3.1
Establish costings and availability of required resources from reliable contacts and information sources. 
3.2
Prepare and present budget to relevant personnel for approval, ensuring necessary modifications and compromises are incorporated. 
3.3
Ensure budget reflects realistic achievement of creative and technical production requirements, availability of resources and personnel requirements. 
3.4
Compile, adjust and finalise a resource schedule, including adequate contingency plans.

CUFPOP05B.Elements and Performance Criteria:
Elements and performance criteria
Element
Performance Criteria
1
Analyse resource requirements
1.1
Read and correctly interpret all relevant production documentation, including production schedule/script. 
1.2
Identify production requirements accurately, based on scale and concept of the production and available resource schedules. 
1.3
Develop and maintain accurate records of resource requirements and production brief. 
2
Source production resources
2.1
Identify appropriate sources for required resources. 
2.2
Identify and research new sources of supply where required. 
2.3
Negotiate costs to achieve optimum budget outcomes. 
2.4
Identify, clarify and communicate appropriate responsibilities of all relevant personnel in relation to resource acquisition and management. 
2.5
Resource alternatives if resources requested are not available after consultation with relevant personnel. 
3
Organise resource bookings
3.1
Book resources as required to meet production brief and budget, and in accordance with organisational procedures. 
3.2
Prepare letters of agreement and other relevant resource documentation for resources according to organisational procedures. 
3.3
Make and record amendments and adjustments accurately according to organisational procedures. 
3.4
Action and record payment requirements at the appropriate time according to organisational procedures. 
3.5
Update suppliers regarding changes to requirements according to agreed procedures. 
3.6
Advise suppliers of final details and requirements according to the particular booking and organisational procedures. 
3.7
Select and organise appropriate transport where required, ensuring adequate security. 
3.8
Communicate relevant information on resource acquisition to production colleagues. 
4
Monitor resources during production
4.1
Make regular checks on supply and condition of resources with relevant personnel. 
4.2
Manage efficient distribution of resources throughout production, maintaining sufficient supply of resources to meet production requirements, budget and schedule. 
4.3
Ensure resources are handled and stored as appropriate. 
5
Maintain resource documentation
5.1
Keep inventories of resources in accordance with organisational procedures. 
5.2
Record and file booking details, including request, confirmation and future action, according to organisational procedures. 
5.3
Ensure any required clearances and permits are recorded. 
5.4
Record and check points of dispatch and return in accordance with organisational procedures.

Element
Performance Criteria
